revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Domingos Quina | image = Quina London Stadium.jpg | image_size = | caption = Quina (right) coming on as a substitute for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2016 | fullname = Domingos Quina{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|11|18|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bissau]], [[Guinea-Bissau]] | height = 1.77 m | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]]
[[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 20 | youthyears1 = 2013 | youthclubs1 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] | youthyears2 = 2013–2016 | youthclubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | youthyears3 = 2016–2018 | youthclubs3 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | years1 = 2016–2018 | clubs1 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps2 = 7 | goals2 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 14 | nationalgoals1 = 8 | nationalyears2 = 2016 | nationalteam2 = [[Portugal national under-18 football team|Portugal U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016– | nationalteam3 = [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 19 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2017– | nationalteam4 = [[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | pcupdate = 08:49, 26 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 23 July 2018 }} '''Domingos Quina''' (born 18 November 1999) is a Portuguese [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. Despite being born in [[Guinea-Bissau]], he has represented [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at international youth level. He is the son of former Portugal international [[Defender (association football)|defender]] [[Samuel Quina]].{{cite web |url=https://www.ojogo.pt/internacional/noticias/interior/domingos-quina-assina-pelo-west-ham-5141895.html |title=Domingos Quina assina pelo West Ham |work=O Jogo |date=24 April 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}} ==Career== ===West Ham=== Having spent time at the academies of [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] and [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], he was offered a contract by [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]],{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10944712/west-hams-domingos-quina-wanted-by-arsenal|title=West Ham's Domingos Quina wanted by Arsenal|publisher=Sky Sports |date=11 July 2017 |accessdate=12 July 2018}} but Quina decided to sign for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in May 2016 with the expectation that he would join the squad in July 2016 and sign a professional contract on his 17th birthday in November 2016.{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/May/25-May/Hammers-sign-young-forward-Quina |title=Hammers sign young forward Quina |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |date=25 May 2016 |accessdate=21 November 2016}} He made his debut, coming on as an 81st-minute substitute for [[Michail Antonio]], against [[NK Domzale]] in the [[Europa League]] on 28 July 2016 and also played a part in the second leg in a 3–0 win in the club's first ever match at [[Olympic Stadium (London)|London Stadium]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36898501|title=NK Domzale 2–1 West Ham United|publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 July 2016|accessdate=9 August 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36964415|title=West Ham United 3-0 NK Domzale (agg 4-2)|publisher=BBC Sport| date=4 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}} On 3 October 2016, Quina scored a widely praised goal for [[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy|West Ham Under 23's]], by scoring a chip from near the halfway line against Leicester Under 23's side.{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/west-hams-16-year-old-8969157|title=West Ham's 16-year-old wonderkid Domingos Quina beats keeper from 40 yards with sublime lob|publisher=Mirror|accessdate=12 July 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/116238 |title=Quina wonder goal gives West Ham winning start |publisher=Premier League |date=2 October 2016 |accessdate=16 July 2018}} Having turned 17, Quina signed his first professional contract with West Ham in November 2016 which could keep him at the club until 2019.{{Cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11685/10666591/domingos-quina-signs-professional-terms-with-west-ham |title=Domingos Quina signs professional terms with West Ham |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 November 2016 |accessdate=14 February 2018}} In the same year, he received two [[Candidate|nominations]] for [[Professional Development League|''Premier League 2'']] "''Player of the Month''" for October, merited for his performances against [[Aston Villa Under-23s and Academy|Aston Villa]], [[Middlesbrough F.C. Reserves and Academy|Middlesbrough]] and West Bromwich Albion respectively.{{Cite news|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/133149|title=PL2 Player of the Month nominees announced|last=|first=|date=4 November 2016|accessdate=18 December 2016|publisher=Premier League}} His performances for [[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy|West Ham Under 23's]] saw [[Sky Sports]] describe Quina as a '[[Child prodigy|wonderkid]]'. ===Watford=== On 9 August 2018, Quina signed for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a four-year contract for a undisclosed fee, believed to be £1 million.{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11686/11467431/domingos-quina-joins-watford-from-west-ham-on-four-year-deal|title=Domingos Quina joins Watford from West Ham on four-year deal|publisher=Sky Sports |date=9 August 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018}}{{cite news |title=Watford 'complete £1million deal' for West Ham wonderkid Domingos Quina - here's what we know |url=https://www.football.london/watford-fc/transfer-news/watford-domingos-quina-west-ham-15011545 |accessdate=1 November 2018 |work=football.london |date=9 August 2018}} He made his Watford debut on 29 August in a second round [[EFL Cup]] game away to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]]. With Watford already leading 1–0, Quina scored with a driving shot, described as "superb", from 30 yards to make to score 2–0, the final result.{{Cite web |title=Reading 0–2 Watford: Domingos Quina scores as Javi Gracia's side keep up 100% start |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 August 2018 |accessdate=29 December 2018 |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45266832}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut for the club on 4 December 2018 coming as a substitute in a 2–1 home loss against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]{{cite web|url=https://maisfutebol.iol.pt/premier-league/inglaterra/bernardo-silva-sofre-para-vencer-watford-de-domingos-quina|title=Bernardo Silva sofre para vencer Watford de Domingos Quina|website=Maisfutebol |date=4 December 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018}} and his first league start in the following match, on 10 December 2018, in a 2–2 away draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].{{Cite web |title=Everton 2–2 Watford: Lucas Digne's late free-kick rescues point for hosts |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 December 2018 |accessdate=29 December 2018 |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46422266}} On 15 December, he became the youngest Watford player to score in the Premier League, in a match against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].{{Cite web |title=Watford 3–2 Cardiff City |first=Katie |last=Falkingham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 December 2018 |accessdate=18 December 2018 |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46491892}} ==International career== Quina has represented Portugal at [[Portugal national under-17 football team|U17]], [[Portugal national under-18 football team|U18]], [[Portugal national under-19 football team|U19]] and [[Portugal national under-20 football team|U20]] level and is eligible to play for the country having moved there as a young child. He won the [[UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] with Portugal in May 2016.{{cite web |url=http://portugoal.net/selecao/451-portugal-crowned-u17-champions-of-europe |title=Portugal crowned U17 Champions of Europe! |first=Tom |last=Kundert |work=PortuGOAL.net |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}} In July 2018, he was a member of the [[Portugal national under-19 football team|U19]] team which won the [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] beating [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy U19]] 4-3 after extra time.{{cite web |url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/july/29-july/quina-becomes-european-champion-second-time |title=Quina becomes European champion for a second time! |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |date=29 July 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018}}{{Cite web | title = Italy 3-4 Portugal| publisher = UEFA|language=English| date = 30 July 2018| accessdate = 30 July 2018| url = https://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2018/matches/round=2000839/match=2024510/index.html}} {{Cite web |title=Domingos Quina, Moise Kean, Joao Filipe impress at Under-19 Euros |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 July 2018 |accessdate=30 July 2018 |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/11454150/domingos-quina-moise-kean-joao-filipe-impress-at-under-19-euros}} ==Honours== ===International=== '''Portugal U17''' *[[UEFA European Under-17 Championship]]: [[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2016]] '''Portugal U19''' *[[UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]: [[2018 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2018]]{{cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2018/matches/round=2000839/match=2024510/index.html/|title=Under-19 - Portugal win epic U19 EURO final|publisher=[[UEFA]]|accessdate=30 July 2018}} ===Individual=== *[[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship Team of the Tournament]]{{cite web|title=Technical Reportfinals|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2016/technical-report/tr-under17-2016.pdf|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=24 October 2016}} *[[2018 UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Team of the Tournament|UEFA European Under-19 Championship Team of the Tournament]]: [[2018 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2018]]{{cite web|title=Under-19 EURO team of the tournament|url=https://www.uefa.com/under19/news/newsid=2565932.html|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=4 August 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 22 February 2019}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|[[FA Cup]] !colspan=2|[[Football League Cup|League Cup]] !colspan=2|[[UEFA#Club|Europe]] !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=3|[[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |[[2016–17 West Ham United F.C. season|2016–17]]{{soccerbase season|id=96153|season=2016|accessdate=30 December 2018}} |rowspan=2|[[Premier League]] |0||0||0||0||0||0||2Appearances in [[UEFA Europa League]]||0|| colspan="2" |—||2||0 |- |[[2017–18 West Ham United F.C. season|2017–18]]{{soccerbase season|id=96153|season=2017|accessdate=30 December 2018}} |0||0||1||0||3||0|| colspan="2" |—|| colspan="2" |—||4||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !0!!0!!1!!0!!3!!0!!2!!0!!0!!0!!6!!0 |- | rowspan="3" |[[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s|West Ham U-23s]] |[[2016–17 Professional U23 Development League|2016–17]] | rowspan="2" |[[Professional Development League|Premier League 2]] |colspan="8"|—||1Appearance(s) in the [[EFL Trophy]]||0||1||0 |- |[[2017–18 Professional U23 Development League|2017–18]] | colspan="8"|—||4||0||4||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total ! colspan="8" |—!!5!!0!!5!!0 |- |[[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |[[2018–19 Watford F.C. season|2018–19]]{{soccerbase season|id=96153|season=2018|accessdate=30 December 2018}} |[[Premier League]] |7||1||3||0||2||1|| colspan="2" |—|| colspan="2" |—||12||2 |- !colspan=3|Career total !7!!1!!4!!0!!5!!1!!2!!0!!5!!0!!23!!2 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Domingos Quina}} *[https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/domingos-quina Watford player profile] *{{soccerway}} {{Watford F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quina, Domingos}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1999 births]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Bissau]] [[Category:Portuguese footballers]] [[Category:Portugal youth international footballers]] [[Category:Bissau-Guinean footballers]] [[Category:Portuguese people of Bissau-Guinean descent]] [[Category:West Ham United F.C. players]] [[Category:Chelsea F.C. players]] [[Category:S.L.
